agarose gel electrophoresis 琼脂糖凝胶电泳
Aerospace Ground Equipment 航天地面设备

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"时期，时代"之意。
means: age ：常指具有显著特征或以某杰出人物命名的历史时代或时期。
epoch ：正式用词，侧重指以某重大事件或巨大变化为起点的新的历史时期。
era ：书面语用词，指历史上的纪元、年代，可与epoch和age互换，侧重时期的延续性和整个历程。
period ：最普通用词，概念广泛，时间长短不限，既可指任何一个历史时期，又可指个人或自然界的一个发展阶段。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"成熟，长成"之意。
means: mature ： 指生物自然发育成熟或丰满或使其能起正常作用，还可指人获得智慧、经验或变得世故。
ripen ： 侧重已到长生成熟的顶点。
age ： 一般指使人过早成熟，强调已走向衰老。
develop ： 侧重使某一种类或个体潜在本能进化完全，词义比mature广泛。

word_mean: 年龄，时期：以单位时间计的个体生活时间
智龄：衡量某种个体特性，以一般正常人显示同等熟练程度的时序(实足)年龄回报，如智力成就年龄
老化，老衰：时间流逝带来的改变
length key 根据各体长组的年龄组成绘制的表格。

sentence.Network_cn: 有些情况下有最低年龄限制。

jx.jx_en_mean: To reach an age, 18 or 21 years, for example, at which one is no longer eligible for certain special services, such as education or protection, from the state.

jx.jx_cn_mean: （人）成年（英国法律现规定18岁成年，原为21岁）

jx.jx_en_mean: old enough to be able or expected to do something

lj.lj_ly: the sons are of an age to marry.
lj.lj_ls: 儿子们到了结婚的年龄。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of two or more people or things) of a similar age

lj.lj_ly: the children all seemed of an age.
lj.lj_ls: 孩子们看起来差不多大。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French, based on Latin aetas, aetat-, from aevum 'age, era'

entry.def: Your age is the number of years that you have lived.

example.ex: She has a nephew who is just ten years of age...
At the age of sixteen he qualified for a place at the University of Hamburg...
example.tran: 16岁时，他就有资格进入汉堡大学。

entry.def: The age of a thing is the number of years since it was made.

example.ex: Everything in the room looks in keeping with the age of the building.
example.tran: 房间里的一切看起来都与这栋建筑物的存在年头很相称。

entry.def: Age is the state of being old or the process of becoming older.

example.ex: Perhaps he has grown wiser with age...
example.tran: 可能随着年纪增长，他变聪明了。

example.ex: The fabric was showing signs of age...
example.tran: 这块衣料可以看出岁月留下的痕迹。

entry.def: When someone ages, or when something ages them, they seem much older and less strong or less alert.

example.ex: He had always looked so young, but he seemed to have aged in the last few months...
example.tran: 他原来一直看起来很年轻，但最近几个月他显得老了。

example.ex: He was only in his mid-thirties, but already worry had aged him.
example.tran: 他虽然只有三十五六岁，但忧虑让他很显老。

entry.def: When food or alcohol is aged or when it ages, it is left to get older before being eaten or drunk, so that it develops a better flavour.

example.ex: Balsamic vinegar is aged in wood for at least 10 years and the flavour is wonderful...
example.tran: 意大利香醋在木桶中就经历了至少10年的酝酿期，所以口味极佳。

example.ex: Whisky loses strength as it ages.
example.tran: 存放时间越久，威士忌的口味越淡。

entry.def: An age is a period in history.
You can say an age or ages to mean a very long time.

example.ex: He waited what seemed an age...
The bus took absolutely ages to arrive.
example.tran: 公共汽车过了很长时间才来。

entry.def: If someone tells you to act your age, they are telling you to behave in a way that is suitable for someone your age, because they think you are behaving in a childish way.
If something comes of age, it reaches an important stage of development and is accepted by a large number of people.

example.ex: Recycling is an issue that has come of age in Britain in the last decade.
example.tran: 回收利用是上个十年中被英国民众广泛认可的观念。

entry.def: When someone comes of age, they become legally an adult.

example.ex: The company was to be held in trust for Eddie until he came of age.
example.tran: 在埃迪达到法定年龄之前，该公司将委托他人代为经营。

entry.tran: 未到合法年龄的;未成年的
entry.def: Someone who is under age is not legally old enough to do something, for example to buy an alcoholic drink.

example.ex: Because she was under age, her parents were still responsible for her.
example.tran: 因为她还未成年，她的父母仍然应为她负责。

sentences.sentence: "it was replaced because of its age"

means.word_mean: 2. an era of history having some distinctive feature;
3. a time in life (usually defined in years) at which some particular qualification or power arises;

sentences.sentence: "The death of his wife caused him to age fast"

jushi.chinese: 很难说出他的确切年龄。

jushi.english: We are living in the computer age.
